Comment: I understand the fear, but what the hell would he actually tariff? The cost of production? How would they even go about finding out that information? There is no tangle product for them to tariff. It's the equivalent of saying that he is going to start tariffing reddit comments from people in other countries because those people are employed.  If they were to impose a tariff on their tax filings, it would just be written off with their P&L and lower the amount of tax that they would have to pay.   Unless I am completely missing something, this just seems like a giant nothing.

Comment: That's what we're trying to figure out. Unless he legitimately believes movies are coming in via VHS tapes on cargo ships, which is a possibility, no one is sure how he'd tax any of this.  Other countries are getting film work by offering federal tax credits that make it cheaper to film over there. The US has state by state tax credits but Georgia or Illinois can't compete with Canada or the UK by themselves. California is trying to but they've got their own additional costs that still make it expensive.   If he wasn't a fucking idiot he could just toss a 10% federal tax credit that stacks on top of the state tax credits and outdo these other countries.
